medical_history.chief_complaint: Right inguinal lymphadenopathy, fever, and drenching night sweats.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual state of health until 2 weeks before admission, when swelling of the right groin developed. Over the next 2 weeks, the swollen area increased in size. Concurrently, drenching night sweats and daily fevers developed, with temperatures as high as 38.3Â°C.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) diagnosed 27 years ago, history of lymphocytosis, splenomegaly, anemia, and multiple courses of chlorambucil, fludarabine, and rituximab treatments. Other history includes recurrent HSV infections, hypogammaglobulinemia, diverticulosis, and a burst fracture of the first lumbar vertebra.
medical_history.family_history: Heart disease in the mother, skin cancer in the father.
medical_history.social_history: Quit smoking 40 years ago, drinks alcohol occasionally, not sexually active, retired librarian, lives in Massachusetts, has not traveled outside the United States.
